Class SimBox

java.lang.Object

                          +--javax.swing.JFrame
                                |
                                +--eecs.jago.SimBox
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, Realism, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.WindowConstants
Direct Known Subclasses:
AParkSimulation, CentralAreaSimulation, DetonatorSimulation, DisarmingSim, ExampleCases, FDWSelection, IterationHW, SlotsSimulation
public class SimBox
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements Realism

This is the main simulation window that contains the simulation and a text area that can be used for simulation (system) and user messages.

This class also implements the ability to start and stop the simulation via a menu option; these options should be used sparingly, since they make the assumption that stopping the simulation will not adversely affect the user's thread.

Bugs:

  • If the user's thread is not interacting with the simulation, the simulation will stop, but the user's thread will continue, and the resulting executing might differ from an execution where the simulation wasn't stopped.
  • If the user's thread used a goForward or goBackward command for a robot (or other methods that return immediately), execution of the user's thread will continue even though the simulation stopped. So, any assumptions about time will be invalid.
  • Use of the System time (currentTimeMillis) will not coincide with the simulation, since simulation time will be stopped.

See Also:
Serialized Form

public SimBox(int width,

SimBox

public SimBox(int width,
              int height,
              java.lang.String bkgnd,
              boolean tiled)
Creates a new SimBox with the size and background.

Parameters:
width - The desired width of the simulation area, in pixels
height - The desired height of the simulation area, in pixels
bkgnd - The name of the image to use as a background (must be a jpg or gif image)
tiled - true if the image should be tiled to fill the simulation space. If this parameter is false, the simulation area will be resized to match the size of the image.
Method Detail

setBackgroundImage

public void setBackgroundImage(java.lang.String fileName)
Sets the background image of the SimBox. The SimBox will use a default background if the image does not exist in either the current (user) directory, or relative to the SimBox package (the ImageLoader will check both).

Parameters:
fileName - The name of the image to load (must be either jpg or gif image)

setBackgroundImage

public void setBackgroundImage(java.awt.Image img)
Sets the background image of the simulation to the specified image.

Parameters:
img - The Image to use as a background.

setBackgroundTile

public void setBackgroundTile(java.lang.String fileName)
Sets the background tile of the SimBox. You can tile an image as the background by using this method. To use a single image as the background, use setBackgroundImage instead. If the image cannot be found, a default background will be used.

Parameters:
fileName - The name of the image file.

add

public void add(SimElement element,
                double xLoc,
                double yLoc)
Attempts to add the SimElement to the simulation at the specified location. The usable canvas of a SimBox is 8 pixels narrower than its size, and about 35 pixels shorter than its height (due to the title bar).

Parameters:
element - The element to add
xLoc - The desired horizontal location
yLoc - The desired vertical location

add

public void add(StandardRobot element,
                double xLoc,
                double yLoc,
                int heading)
Deprecated. As of Version 5.1 of Jago (eecs.jago)

Adds a robot to the simulation with an initial heading. Provided for compatability with legacy Jago applications. Deprecated as of version 5.1 of the simulation.

Parameters:
element - The StandardRobot to add.
xLoc - The desired horizontal location
yLoc - The desired vertical location
heading - The initial heading of the StandardRobot

Overrides:
removeAll in class java.awt.Container

start

public void start()
Starts running the simualation.
In this version, the start and stop commands are potentially dangerous because although they stop the simulation, they assume that stopping the execution of the simulation will not affect the user's program, since the user thread is still executing.

stop

public void stop()
Stops running the simualation.

In this version, the start and stop commands are potentially dangerous because although they stop the simulation, they assume that stopping the execution of the simulation will not affect the user's program, since the user thread is still executing.

Any movement that relies on the system time may be corrupted if the simulation is stopped because although the simulation is not running, all time-based information is based on the system clock, not on a simulation clock.

updateSizes

public void updateSizes(java.awt.Dimension d)
Sets the size of the SimBox and simulation engine workspace.

Parameters:
d - The new Dimension of the simulation. The Dimension should reflect the size of the actual simulation area, not the size of the entire Jago workspace.

Sets the size of the SimBox and simulation engine workspace.

Parameters:
width - The new width of the simulation
height - The new height of the simulation

updateWindows

protected void updateWindows()
If the windows need updated, this method will be called. This method should not be called by the user; it should only be called from paint.
